Posts.Content: May 19, 2010 08:33PM Victoria21 wrote: Mommy to 4 great kids:  I am new to this forum too and found it so helpful. Thank you ladies for all your tips.  I too am scheduled for 1st round tomorrow 5/20 and am also doing TAC x 6 every 3 weeks. We can do this!
Posts.Title: May 2010 Chemo fotopet leftduetostupidmods

Posts.Content: May 21, 2010 05:00PM Victoria21 wrote: Hey ladies My first treatment yesterday (TAC) was supposed to be 3 hours but turned into 6-1/2 hours due to reaction from Taxotere.  Onco said I now have to do a slower drip.  Glad to be home.  No major SE's.  Just a little tummy ache and some white tongue.  The anti nausea meds (companzine & zofran) are keeping the nausea away.  Drinking cranberry juice and taking AZO cranberry pills too.  Just glad to be at home!  You ladies that have to go to work are my heroes! Hang in there ladies and thanks for all your tips.  They are helping me so much! Victoria
Posts.Title: May 2010 Chemo fotopet leftduetostupidmods

Posts.Content: May 27, 2010 02:58PM Victoria21 wrote: Hello everyone and best wishes Checking in day 7 after 1st round of chemo.  Had 1st blood check yesterday and WBC is dangerously low at 1.0.  Being super careful to not get sick.  Onco gave me prescip. of Cipro anti-biotic as precaution. When I was feeling anemic (fatigued and short of breath) my nurse suggested slow-release iron pills.  They are called Slow-Fe and I took one every day with 1 colace stool softener.  What a difference!  I felt so much better and now my blood tests determined my red blood cell count is back to pre-chemo "normal" levels.  Now I don't need to take them anymore.  Hope this tip helps any of you feel better. Love to all... Victoria
Posts.Title: May 2010 Chemo fotopet leftduetostupidmods

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2010 12:35PM Victoria21 wrote: hi I'm 37 and recently diagnosed with IDC.  I am going to have surgery sometime in April and I opted for bilateral mastectomy with expanders, then saline implants after radiation.  My female surgeon had no problem with me removing the healthy breast but I'm still wondering if it's the right thing to do.  Any thoughts?
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2010 05:58PM Victoria21 wrote: Hello ladies Just checking in after surgery. Had BMX with proph. on right side on the 13th.  Woke up in lots of pain.  Just didn't have the right medicine.  Morphine didn't do anything for me but make me sick.  Sounds like percoset works well, I got sent home with RX of hydrocodone, called "norco".  Spent 2nd night in hospital only because morphine was making me so sick.  Took a few days for my bladder to "wake up".  Glad to be home and be done with catheters.  Have 4 drains and put them in fanny pack during the day.  Have had small bits of leakage from drainage sites.  Just have to be careful about pullingon them.  Saw PS today and will get drains out next week since there is barely anything coming out.  Healing well and getting better every day.  Thinking of all of you!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2010 06:11PM Victoria21 wrote: Dustysmom: We have the same surgery date and time in CA.  I decided to do the bilateral mastectomy with TE, then saline implants.  You'll be in my thoughts as we go on this journey together...
